body:
Hi all,

I am trying to get a cumulative sky matrix for the whole year with only clear skies, is it possible to do with ladybug/honeybee?

The purpose of this is to be able to find the solar position that produces the peak solar heat gains in a specific room. For that purpose I cannot use a typical weather data file.

The alternative would be to buy a meteonorm license to get a weather file with only clear skies, but first I wanted to check if it was possible to solve this within LB/HB.

Thanks in advance!

Ale
topic: Create cumulative sky matrix with only clear skies

replies.body: Hi Ale, I made an alternative version of the LB sunrise/sunset that calculates GHI, DNI, DHI by using Bird Clear Sky Model (R. Bird, R. Hulstrom) a couple of months ago. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/IHl76p8QjssClq8qICjepyRyI7kAvEdCQll8pthdb6mf3uQ-llzKtDexqUi80vgtX5geArzRAXGrH8PKqpP-AREb354II5Xe/rad_clearSky_BirdModel01.png) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/IHl76p8Qjsvtva2oFJtYI33B6KvotB8PS*6xmFAjA0FJ9iqntWp0LxwOrVN7jBbh64HIyVCp7XFjfEt7wafWZ2tUJU1jWqca/rad_clearSky_Birdmodel_02.png) I even made a cloudy sky version of Bird Model by following NREL's formula, however it works just for GHI. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/IHl76p8QjssNer5qROKlL93soPLsw5gWieZ8lMoAOw723ZLb6ChFRozm*Vw8QyCgG8A5ViM-FK30dlsKcyfpy8jeJFYRlBzV/rad_clearSky_cloudycorrection03.png) I have used a component which copies and modifies EPW files ([http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/ladybug-wea...](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/ladybug-weather-file)), and I used the results which come from Bird Model. Probably it works,  but I have to see if the results are good enough. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/IHl76p8QjsvXr9sDiaMonQshPdhWTrC*PHw3t-*5eb32wCQUDiBfxzoXYS-xYFVS9Uewmui6jig299VHwIUB0j0FR4M1QR7o/rad_clearSky_Birdmodel_EPWedit.png) [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/IHl76p8QjsuCD1SHd3OyAOF6qUpfXrBXEhWiJb7PkiGSPDxP7fFp8F81jpGDtCzWBonBo2fV4BwswY64sUJxeu523aoUJuek/rad_clearSky_Birdmodel_EPWedit_02.png) Best Antonello
